TopicTitle: Game crash on reverting/returning to space center

Articles.Content:
The title says it all. Every time my game crashes when I try to revert launch, or when I'm in flight and try to return to the Space Center. Does anyone know if any of these mods conflict?

ActionGroupsExtended

Asteroid Recycling Technologies

Active Texture Management

B9

Deadly Reentry

Editor Extensions

EVE

Extraplanetary Launchpads

FAR

Fine Print

Infernal Robotics

Karbonite

USI Kolonization Systems

KAS

Kerbal Alarm Clock

KW

MechJeb

NavBall Docking Alignment Indicator

Precise Node

RCSBuildAid

RemoteTech

SCANsat

StageRecovery

TAC Life Support

Tech Manager (For KSPI, however I haven't added it yet)

TextureReplacer

Toolbar

Trajectories

Transfer Window Planner

TweakScale

Wauw, that was a mouthful I'll also add a crashdump for anyone understands it (I don't obvious).

http://www./download/0l70ry2aianekel/2014-11-11_184552.rar
Looks like an out of memory crash, but it's hard to be sure without the output_log.txt. Did you remove it?

Looks like an out of memory crash, but it's hard to be sure without the output_log.txt. Did you remove it?

No, I rar'd everything in the folder

You only included the standard log, this file shows what is actually causing the crashes (usually...)

<KSP install dir>\KSP_Data\output_log.txt

but I have to agree, from the normal log it looks like an out of memory crash.

No, I rar'd everything in the folder

I think we can't really help you, we need the output_log.txt, if you don't know where it is located, you can read this : http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229

EDIT: too late

http://www./view/9kocl2w8jjs8erb/output_log.txt

Here it is. Sorry for not providing it earlier, I didn't know about this one
Unfortunately, the output_log.txt file gets overwritten every time you start the game. That log shows a sudden exit half way through the loading process, not the crash you described...

Unfortunately, the output_log.txt file gets overwritten every time you start the game. That log shows a sudden exit half way through the loading process, not the crash you described...

God damnit! I'll try and replicate it. One moment

Ahh yep its a memory crash. It means above 3.8 GB of RAM use and then crashes. Is there a way ask ATM to selectively reduce some textures more then others, or is there some other way to reduce RAM load without reducing the textures any further then the standard ATM settings? I have heard about this DDS texture mod, but I know nothing of it. Could this help?

You can try the -force-opengl option, which offloads texture memory to your video card.

There are also mod-specific configs for ATM Ã¢â‚¬â€œ there are dozens included and instructions are in Active Texture Management/settings.cfg.

It looks like you just have too many mods. When KSP jumps scenes it suddenly inflates it's memory profile for a short period of time, this can cause segmentation faults in the heap if there is not enough memory to meet this memory profile.

B9 and KW are particularly bad at eating up resources.

You could either remove the parts you don't use, Install Active Texture Management, or do both. (I recommmend both.)

I've also been having some issues but usually removing EVE solves it because it consumes most of the actual RAM. Still get random crashes sometimes but that's just the nature of the game and I've decided to live with it

I've had the same issue, but I clocked in at 3.6 GBs instead of 3.8, which means I still had 0.2GBs free and thus wasn't an OOM CTD.

Some of my mods are the same as OP's;

KAS

Kerbal Alarm Clock

MechJeb

NavBall Docking Alignment Indicator

Precise Node

SCANsat

Toolbar

Trajectories

Crash!!!

**** Crash! ****
thats the same thing thats happening to me

I have watched my system's ram usage quite a bit. Every time I revert to launch, or to Assembly, it increased the ram usage for some reason. It does it every single time. Larger craft create larger usage per revert but even a 2 part craft uses more RAM after each and every revert.
